Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.hpack

Class Encoder

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.hpack.Encoder
public class Encoder extends Object
An HPACK HTTP/2 header encoder.
Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Field Details

      protected static final List<Header> STATIC_TABLE

      protected static final int STATIC_TABLE_SIZE

  • Constructor Details

    • Encoder

      public Encoder(int headerTableSize, int maxHeaderListSize)
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      headerTableSize - the maximum size for the dynamic table
      maxHeaderListSize - the maximum size of any list of headers to encode

  • Method Details

    • setHeaderTableSize

      public void setHeaderTableSize(int size)
      Sets a new value for SETTINGS_HEADER_TABLE_SIZE. If this value is less than the current dynamic table size, The first thing we need to do in an encode is to issue a dynamic table size update and evict entries from the dynamic table.

    • setMaxHeaderListSize

      public void setMaxHeaderListSize(int size)
      Sets the maximum uncompressed size of a complete header list. If the list of headers supplied to encode exceeds this value in size, it will throw a ProtocolException. The server should then send a HPACK_DECOMPRESSION_FAILURE error and terminate the connection.

    • setAutoHuffman

      public void setAutoHuffman(boolean flag)
      Set whether to prefer Huffman encoding. If true, when writing headers we will prefer Huffman encoding if it results in a shorter encoded sequence. If set to false, we won't use Huffman encoding of keys or values.

    • setNoIndexing

      public void setNoIndexing(boolean flag)
      Set whether to ignore the max header size and not add entries to the dynamic table when writing.

    • encode

      public void encode(ByteBuffer buf, List<Header> headers) throws ProtocolException
      Writes the specified header list to a byte buffer.
      Parameters:
      buf - the buffer to write to
      headers - the headers to write
      Throws:
      ProtocolException - if the size of the headers exceeds the maximum header list size

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception
      Throws:
      Exception

    • tableSize

      protected static int tableSize(List<Header> table)
      The size of a dynamic table is the sum of the size of its entries.

    • headerSize

      protected static int headerSize(Header header)
      The size of an entry is the sum of its name's length in octets (as defined in Section 5.2), its value's length in octets, and 32. The size of an entry is calculated using the length of its name and value without any Huffman encoding applied.
